result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen C Judon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including sex offender treatment and cognitive behavioral treatment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  No contact with the victim E.C. (person, property, residence or family).  Comply with all Child Support and/or Family Court orders. Comply with all sex offender requirements.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Attorney Obi Uzowulu appears for Atty Aieen Henry in court, defendant Allen C Judon not in court, in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The defendant refuses to come down to Court. The Court inquires of defense if they feel there is a conflict of interest due to the Court knowing the victim's mother from work and socially. Mr. Uzowulu indicates that deft wishes Ms. Henry to withdraw and refuses to speak with either Ms. Henry or Ms. Uzowulu. Defense asks for motion hearing for atty to withdraw.

BTC: The Court recuses itself from this matter.
1-06-16  Preliminary hearing
Status conference on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allen C Judon in court with attorney Jeremy Chavez for Aileen Henry.  Defendant Allen C Judon in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties have received an anonymous complaint that the Court knows the mother of the victim and the Court confirms that it does, in fact, know the person in question and considers the person in question a friend.
If defendant has any concerns, the Court will recuse itself. Defense indicates the defendant stands mute to recusal. Atty Henry is still investigating and asks for STC in 30-45 days

BTC: At this point, the Court does not feel it necessary to recuse itself.  Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
